text:
How did President Trump do in the more than 2,600 counties that voted for him in 2016?

We analyzed the shifts in the margin of victories in those counties to find out. https://t.co/TnLBQKbuQU

name: nytimes
text:
Four years ago, Trump won those 2,600+ counties by an overall margin of 28 percentage points over Hillary Clinton. 

There were significant shifts toward Trump that year in some counties that voted for Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012. https://t.co/4wEiFAZDiJ https://t.co/dEcix8cweB

name: nytimes
text:
This year, Trump won most of those counties again, but his overall margin shifted slightly to the left ‚Äî by nearly three points in the votes reported so far.

Some counties Trump won shifted to Joe Biden. https://t.co/4wEiFAZDiJ https://t.co/UvtqTNpug6

name: nytimes
text: Of the more than 1,400 counties that had shifted at least 10 points to the right from 2012 to Trump in 2016, some snaked to the left this year but a vast majority of them continued to firmly support him, or shifted even further to the right. https://t.co/4wEiFAZDiJ https://t.co/j5992d4XSc
